item.title: Makefile overview
item.description: What is makefile. How to write a makefile. Ref: https://opensource.com/article/18/8/what-how-makefile What is makefile A makefile is a file containing a set of directives used by a make build automation tool to generate a target/goal. You may have used make to compile a program from source code. How to write makefile To summarize, below is the syntax of a typical rule: 1 2 target: prerequisites <TAB> recipe As an example, a target might be a binary file that depends on prerequisites (source files).
